alert.note: Alert for Loudon; McMinn; Meigs; Morgan (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 12:06AM CST until March 20 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Loudon, McMinn, Meigs, Morgan, Rhea and Roane. * WHEN...Until 415 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 106 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oak Ridge, Athens, Lenoir City, Dayton, Kingston, Sweetwater, Rockwood, Loudon, Decatur, Farragut, Fairview, Oliver Springs, Spring City, Midtown, Harriman, Graysville, Niota, Philadelphia, Oakdale and Ten Mile. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
